desc: NOT AVAILABLE IN THE U.S. except for 2010 and some 2011 model year BMWs when it was offered in the U.S. There are no factory tweeters present in the pods behind the side mirrors, except in some 3 Series Convertibles or X5 models. If you live in the U.S. and have any model year BMW besides 2010 or 2011, you do not have this audio system. If you live outside the U.S., this is the audio system which comes standard on most BMWs. Specifics vary by vehicle, but this audio system is generally characterized by a lack of an external amplifier, and usually just 6 total speakers (often without tweeters), and generally very poor overall performance.

Harman Kardon Surround Sound System, S688A - If you have "HK" or Harman Kardon labels in your interior, you have this audio system. If you do not have those labels, then you do not have this audio system. If you do not have those labels, then you do not have this audio system.

NOT AVAILABLE IN THE U.S. except for 2010 and some 2011 model year BMWs when it was offered in the U.S. There are no factory tweeters present in the pods behind the side mirrors, except in some 3 Series Convertibles or X5 models. If you live in the U.S. and have any model year BMW besides 2010 or 2011, you do not have this audio system. If you live outside the U.S., this is the audio system which comes standard on most BMWs. Specifics vary by vehicle, but this audio system is generally characterized by a lack of an external amplifier, and usually just 6 total speakers (often without tweeters), and generally very poor overall performance.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Specifics vary by vehicle, but this audio system is generally characterized by a lack of an external amplifier, and usually just 6 total speakers (often without tweeters), and generally very poor overall performance.

Hi-Fi Speaker System, S676A - This is the "standard" audio system offered in BMWs in the U.S. (except model years 2010 and 2011 when "Base" was standard equipment) and an optional upgrade for BMWs outside the U.S. If you live in the U.S. and do not have one of BMW's "Premium" audio system offerings or a 2010 or 2011 model year BMW, you have this audio system. Although exact specifics vary from vehicle to vehicle, this audio system is generally characterized by 10 total speakers and an external amplifier, no user adjustable "DSP" processing or equalizer settings, and "average" overall performance.

HiFi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system offered on 5 Series, M5, 7 Series, X3, X5, and Z4 vehicles from the mid-90's to mid-00's. If you have ANY of the following on your radio or nav controls, you have this audio system: - "DSP" button or selection on your radio or nav - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall") - Multi-band equalizer (NOTE: If you have an M5, you may have M Audio. Check your vehicle's trunk. If there are two 10" subwoofers hanging from your rear deck, you have M Audio.) Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the Standard "HiFi" system.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi Speaker System, S676A - This is the "standard" audio system offered in BMWs in the U.S. (except model years 2010 and 2011 when "Base" was standard equipment) and an optional upgrade for BMWs outside the U.S. If you live in the U.S. and do not have one of BMW's "Premium" audio system offerings or a 2010 or 2011 model year BMW, you have this audio system. Although exact specifics vary from vehicle to vehicle, this audio system is generally characterized by 10 total speakers and an external amplifier, no user adjustable "DSP" processing or equalizer settings, and "average" overall performance.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

HiFi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system offered on 5 Series, M5, 7 Series, X3, X5, and Z4 vehicles from the mid-90's to mid-00's. If you have ANY of the following on your radio or nav controls, you have this audio system: - "DSP" button or selection on your radio or nav - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall") - Multi-band equalizer (NOTE: If you have an M5, you may have M Audio. Check your vehicle's trunk. If there are two 10" subwoofers hanging from your rear deck, you have M Audio.) Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the Standard "HiFi" system.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

HiFi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system offered on 5 Series, M5, 7 Series, X3, X5, and Z4 vehicles from the mid-90's to mid-00's. If you have ANY of the following on your radio or nav controls, you have this audio system: - "DSP" button or selection on your radio or nav - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall") - Multi-band equalizer (NOTE: If you have an M5, you may have M Audio. Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the Standard "HiFi" system.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Individual Audio System, Option Code S752A - Available only on "M" model BMWs such as the M3, M5, M6, and so on, this is BMW's "ultimate" audio system, positioned above the Premium audio system offerings. This offering replaced the earlier "DIRAC" system. If you do not have an "M" car, you do not have this audio system. Changes from the "normal" Premium (e.g. Logic7, Harman Kardon, etc.) system are different speakers, a more powerful amplifier, additional DSP processing, and better hardware crossovers. Enhanced Premium Sound is difficult to identify physically as it has the same number of speakers and locations as the "normal" Premium audio systems. Check with your local BMW dealer if you are unsure.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.

Harman Kardon Surround Sound System, S688A - If you have "HK" or Harman Kardon labels in your interior, you have this audio system. If you do not have those labels, then you do not have this audio system. If you do not have those labels, then you do not have this audio system.

Hi-Fi Speaker System, S676A - This is the "standard" audio system offered in BMWs in the U.S. (except model years 2010 and 2011 when "Base" was standard equipment) and an optional upgrade for BMWs outside the U.S. If you live in the U.S. and do not have one of BMW's "Premium" audio system offerings or a 2010 or 2011 model year BMW, you have this audio system. Although exact specifics vary from vehicle to vehicle, this audio system is generally characterized by 10 total speakers and an external amplifier, no user adjustable "DSP" processing or equalizer settings, and "average" overall performance.

Hi-Fi System Professional DSP, S677A - This is BMW's "premium" audio system referred to internally by BMW as "Top Hi-Fi" or "Hi-Fi System Professional DSP." There are a number of different names under which this system may be marketed depending on the year and model of your BMW: - Logic7 - Premium "DSP" - Professional DSP If your vehicle is equipped with one of these audio system types listed above or referred to by your dealer or invoice as having option code S677A, you have this audio system type. You have this audio system if you have ANY of the following on your radio, nav, or interior (although you may have this audio system even without the below features): - Spacial effects (such as "Concert Hall")* - "Surround" or "Logic7" setting* - Multi-band equalizer* Specifics vary, but this system is generally characterized by a more powerful amplifier, DSP (digital signal processing) for equalization and/or spacial effects, better speaker construction, and additional speakers or subwoofers versus the "HiFi" system. *If you have an "M" vehicle (M3, M5, etc.) you may have DIRAC or Enhanced Premium Sound (EPS). Please view the descriptions of those audio systems to determine whether you have DIRAC or EPS, or check with your dealer.
